lead_paragraph: The stem cell debate of the 1990s is recalled in legislation that touches on the fate of unused embryos.

headline.print_headline: House Measure Protecting Embryos Threatens Veterans’ Fertility Treatments
headline.main: House Measure Protecting Embryos Threatens Veterans’ Fertility Treatments

snippet: The stem cell debate of the 1990s is recalled in legislation that touches on the fate of unused embryos....
abstract: Amendment written by Republican Rep Andy Harris of Maryland and passed by House Appropriations subcommittee will prohibit discarding or destroying embryos created by any fertility treatments paid for by Defense Dept and Dept of Veterans Affairs; critics say prohibition effectively prevents use of frozen embryos, greatly curtailing options for fertility treatments for veterans, many of whom have suffered injuries to their reproductive organs during combat.
